title: Gallery Talk: The Art of Plaster
hero_caption: <p>Salvador Dalí, <em>Venus de Milo with Drawers</em>, 1936. Through prior gift of Mrs. Gilbert W. Chapman.</p>
description:
Plaster is often thought of as a not-quite medium: an imitation of ivory or marble, a medium for making models and studies. Join Woman’s Board Fellow Alice Boone for an investigation of plaster art objects in the galleries: some are models for later works, while others are playful commentaries on what we consider original, finished, real, and authoritative.
